[ edit ] Men's Olympiads
Chess Olympiad
Symbol of 6th Chess Olympiad in Warsaw 1935 by J.Steifer
* In 1976 the USSR and other communist countries did not compete for political reasons.
[ edit ] Birth of the Olympiad

[ edit ] Men's Olympiads

[ edit ] See also
[ edit ] Notes
[ edit ] External links
Contents
Bobby Fischer 's score card from his round 3 game against Miguel Najdorf in the 1970 Chess Olympiad.
The 2010 Olympiad is expected to be held in Khanty-Mansiysk , Russia .
[ edit ] Best individual results in men's Olympiads
The 2008 Olympiad is scheduled to be held in Dresden , Germany .

which was offered by the English magnate Frederick Hamilton-Russell as a prize for the 1st Olympiad (London 1927). The cup is kept by the winning team until the next event, when it will be consigned to the next winner. The trophy for the winning women's team is known as the Vera Menchik Cup the first Women's World Chess Champion .
The trophy for winning the men's team is the Hamilton-Russell Cup,
Fischer and Tal at the 1960 Olympiad
Later certain drawbacks where recognized with seeding and in 1976 a Swiss tournament system was adopted.
At first team seeding took place before the competition.
[ edit ] See also
Initially each teams played all the teams but as the event grow over the years this became impossible.
